creator: kevin.roberts@robertsesq.com
text:
Please can you help with this?

make[1]: Entering directory `/usr/src/apache/httpd-2.0.49'
make[1]: *** No rule to make target `modules/yes/mod_yes.la', needed by 
`httpd'.  Stop.
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/apache/httpd-2.0.49'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

creator: kevin.roberts@robertsesq.com
text:
PHP
make clean
./configure --with-mysql --with-apache2=/usr/src/apache/httpd-2.0.49
make
make install
Makes OK

Apache
make clean
./configure --prefix=/www --with-module =src/modules/php4/libphp4.a
makemake[1]: Entering directory `/usr/src/apache/httpd-2.0.49'
make[1]: *** No rule to make target `modules/yes/mod_yes.la', needed by 
`httpd'.  Stop.
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/apache/httpd-2.0.49'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

This is on Debian  and 2.4.26-rc2

./configure --prefix=/www --with-module =src/modules/php4/libphp4.a

The space before the equal sign is the problem.
Anyway, IIRC it's recommended that you should compile apache first and then
invoke php with --with-apxs2.
creator: nd@perlig.de
